intro: Psydrax sambiranensis, commonly known as the Sambiranensis Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
